questions.question: What is the rank of a matrix?
options: The maximum number of linearly independent rows or columns
questions.explanation: The rank of a matrix is the maximum number of linearly independent rows or columns.

questions.question: What is a vector space?
options: A set of vectors that is closed under addition and scalar multiplication
A set of points in the plane
questions.explanation: A vector space is a set of vectors that is closed under addition and scalar multiplication.

questions.question: What is a scalar?
questions.explanation: A scalar is a single number, as opposed to a vector or matrix.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about the determinant of a matrix?
options: It can be either positive, negative, or zero
questions.explanation: The determinant of a matrix can be positive, negative, or zero.

questions.question: What does it mean for a matrix to be invertible?
questions.explanation: A matrix is invertible if and only if its determinant is non-zero.

questions.question: Which of the following operations is used to find the inverse of a matrix?
questions.explanation: Gauss-Jordan elimination is a method used to find the inverse of a matrix.

questions.question: What is an eigenvalue?
options: A scalar associated with a matrix
A vector associated with a matrix
A matrix that represents a transformation
questions.explanation: An eigenvalue is a scalar that characterizes the scaling factor by which an eigenvector is stretched or shrunk during a linear transformation.

questions.question: What is the dot product of two vectors?
questions.explanation: The dot product of two vectors results in a scalar.

questions.question: Which of the following is a property of matrix multiplication?
questions.explanation: Matrix multiplication is associative and distributive but not commutative.

questions.question: What is the rank of the identity matrix?
options: Equal to the size of the matrix
Equal to the number of non-zero elements
questions.explanation: The rank of the identity matrix is equal to the size of the matrix.

questions.question: What does it mean for two matrices to be equal?
options: They must have the same number of rows
They must have the same number of columns
They must have the same dimensions
questions.explanation: Two matrices are equal if they have the same dimensions and corresponding elements are equal.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about an orthogonal matrix?
options: Its rows are orthogonal to each other
Its columns are orthogonal to each other
questions.explanation: An orthogonal matrix is a square matrix whose rows and columns are orthogonal to each other.

questions.question: What is a singular matrix?
options: A matrix that is not square
A matrix with all zero elements
questions.explanation: A singular matrix is one that has a zero determinant and therefore is not invertible.

questions.question: What is the rank of a diagonal matrix?
options: It is the number of non-zero diagonal elements
It is the sum of diagonal elements
questions.explanation: The rank of a diagonal matrix is the number of non-zero diagonal elements.

questions.question: What is the trace of a matrix?
options: The sum of all elements in the matrix
The sum of the diagonal elements
questions.explanation: The trace of a matrix is the sum of its diagonal elements.

questions.question: What does it mean for a system of linear equations to be inconsistent?
questions.explanation: A system of linear equations is inconsistent if it has no solution.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Gaussian elimination?
options: To find the eigenvalues of a matrix
To solve a system of linear equations
To compute the determinant of a matrix
questions.explanation: Gaussian elimination is a method used to solve systems of linear equations.

questions.question: What is the condition for a matrix to be diagonalizable?
questions.explanation: A matrix is diagonalizable if it has distinct eigenvalues.

questions.question: What is the inverse of a diagonal matrix?
options: A matrix with elements equal to the reciprocal of the diagonal elements
questions.explanation: The inverse of a diagonal matrix is also a diagonal matrix with elements equal to the reciprocal of the diagonal elements.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about eigenvectors?
options: They lie along the direction of transformation
They are scaled by the eigenvalue
questions.explanation: Eigenvectors are non-zero vectors that lie along the direction of transformation and are scaled by the eigenvalue.

questions.question: What does the Gram-Schmidt process do?
options: It finds the determinant of a matrix
It orthogonalizes a set of vectors
It solves a system of linear equations
questions.explanation: The Gram-Schmidt process is used to orthogonalize a set of vectors.

questions.question: What is a symmetric matrix?
options: A matrix that is equal to its transpose
A matrix with only zero elements
questions.explanation: A symmetric matrix is one that is equal to its transpose.

questions.question: What does it mean for a set of vectors to be linearly independent?
options: They can be written as a linear combination of each other
None of them can be written as a linear combination of the others
They are parallel to each other
questions.explanation: A set of vectors is linearly independent if none of them can be written as a linear combination of the others.

questions.question: What is the null space of a matrix?
options: The set of all possible solutions to the equation Ax = 0
The set of all diagonal elements
questions.explanation: The null space of a matrix is the set of all possible solutions to the equation Ax = 0.

questions.question: What is a Hermitian matrix?
options: A matrix that is equal to its conjugate transpose
A matrix with all real entries
A matrix with only complex entries
questions.explanation: A Hermitian matrix is one that is equal to its conjugate transpose.

questions.question: What is the column space of a matrix?
options: The set of all linear combinations of the columns of the matrix
The set of all solutions to the equation Ax = b
questions.explanation: The column space of a matrix is the set of all linear combinations of the columns of the matrix.
